On 4/24/10 11:40 AM, sriram_varahan1 wrote:
> Hello,
>
>       I am using Heritrix-3.1.1 Snapshot release. From the release notes I understand it handles updation of mirrors by default. No need to change configuration like the 1.x.x release.

That's not accurate. What part of the release notes gave you that 
impression? We'll correct it.

The MirrorWriter is a contributed component; we don't use or maintain it 
at the Internet Archive.

The duplication-reduction features of Heritrix allow followup crawls to 
skip fetching or storing unchanged material, but they require added 
non-default configuration, in Heritrix 1.x and Heritrix 3.x.

> I have mirrored a website by specifying its URL in a seeds.txt.
>
> First time it downloaded the entire website.
>
> But when I try to launch the job again it only checks for the main URL. If it is not modified it says "Finished" then and there without checking for the remaining URL's which have been mirrored previously.
>
> Is this the desired behaviour of updation or is there any configuration which should be used so that Heritrix checks for all the links which have been previously downloaded for modification.

If you have the most aggressive duplication-reduction settings (sending 
"If-Modified"/"If-None-Match" headers and respecting not-changed 
responses from servers), and Heritrix is able to skip fetching an 
unchanged page entirely, it won't even have the outlinks to continue the 
current crawl. (We don't carry the discovered links forward in the URI 
history info.)

So, if you want use those settings, it's up to you to feed the crawler 
those URIs from the earlier crawl(s) you want it to re-check.

If you turn off the send-if-modified/send-if-none-match settings, the 
crawler will always fetch content, and use only content-checksums to 
detect if a page has changed. The (same old) links are discovered and 
recrawled, and then it is up to the writer-module to skip writing the 
unchanged content.

Carrying forward a history of the outlinks discovered on previous visits 
is under consideration for a future release.

- Gordon @ IA
